page.title: 17Language
page.content: As has been shown (p.6),the people of LINDEAN include a large admixture (40%) of immigrants,mostly either native English or"English-spoken". Their vocabulary ,speech-patterns and -above all else-pronunciation have so completely supplanted the traditional features of the local dialect that the local newspaper has for several years published a weekly article by a native Borderer on dialect words that have vanished from daily use and have become "dictionary words". Limitation of space prevent illustration of local speech except by quotation from a printed source: an extract from a fictitious verse epistle supposed to have been written by an exiled Borderer to a boyhood friend "at home" .The author,James Brown,better known as "J.B.Selkirk",lived at Lindean.
